### Inicializacion de archivo
```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```
### Carga de librerias
``` {r }
library(plyr)
library(dplyr)
library(cluster)
library(e1071)
library(mclust)
library(fpc)
library(NbClust)
library(factoextra)
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(ppclust)
library(randomForest)
library(ggplot2)
library(broom)
library(ggpubr)
library(corrplot)
library(mctest)
library(caret)
library(Amelia)
library(caretEnsemble)
library(psych)
library(mice)
library(GGally)
library(rpart)
library(e1071)
```

### Limpieza de global environment variables (OPCIONAL)
``` {r }
rm(list = ls())
```
### Carga de Datos

``` {r }
path = getwd()

                              sheet=7,skip=1,col_names=TRUE)
```

### Numero de clusters data frame divorcios (Grafica de codo)
``` {r }
datos <- select(divorciosDF,Total,X01,X02,X03,X04,X05,X06,X07,X08,X09,X10,
                X11,X12,X13,X14,X15,X16,X17,X18,X19,X20,X21,X22,X23,X24,X25,X26,X27,X28,X29,X30,X31)
scaledData <- as.matrix(scale(datos))
k.max  <- 15
wss <- sapply(1:k.max, 
              function(k){kmeans(datos,k,iter.max = 100 )$tot.withinss})
plot(1:k.max,wss,
        type="b",
        xlab="No. clusters",
        ylab="No. Suma de cuadrados")
```
### Numero de Clusters (Grafica de Silueta)
``` {r }
km<-kmeans(scaledData, 3, iter.max = 100)
fviz_cluster(km, data = scaledData, frame.type = "convex")
```
### Aplicacion de clusters a Data Inicial y Separacion de grupos
``` {r }
set.seed(123)
divorciosDF$Categoria <- km$cluster
groupOne <- divorciosDF[divorciosDF$Categoria == "Baja",]
```

### Grafica de Silueta
``` {r }
dis = dist(scaledData)^2
sil = silhouette(km$cluster,dis)
dev.new(width=5,height=8,noRStudioGD = TRUE,unit="in")
plot(sil)
```
### Bayes Naive
``` {r }
divorciosDF$Categoria <- factor(divorciosDF$Categoria,levels=c("Baja","Media","Alta"),labels=c(1,2,3))
indxTrain <- createDataPartition(y = divorciosDF$Categoria,p=0.7,list=FALSE)
trainingSet <- divorciosDF[indxTrain,]
testingSet <- divorciosDF[-indxTrain,]
classifier <- naiveBayes(Categoria ~ X01,X02,X03,X04,X05,X06,X07,X08,X09,X10,
                X11,X12,X13,X14,X15,X16,X17,X18,X19,X20,X21,X22,X23,X24,X25,X26,X27,X28,X29,X30,X31,
                data=trainingSet)
predicter <- predict(classifier,newdata=testingSet)
cm <- table(testingSet$Categoria,predicter)
confusionMatrix(cm)
```
